intro: Hibbertia mulligana, commonly known as the Woolly Sunburst, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with red stamens. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Hibbertia mulligana is a perennial shrub that produces fruit capsules containing seeds dispersed by wind.
